results.relevance_explanation: The work as an Electrical Engineer is not related to the Kätilö (AMK) degree program, which focuses on midwifery and related healthcare practices.
results.calculation_breakdown: 1040 hours / 27 hours per ECTS = 38.0 credits, capped at 30.0 maximum for professional training
results.supporting_evidence: The work experience demonstrates general work ethic and responsibility.
results.challenging_evidence: The role of Electrical Engineer and the responsibilities related to 'TBM Electricak' are completely unrelated to midwifery, maternity care, gynecology, or any other aspect of the Kätilö (AMK) curriculum.
results.recommendation: Apply this work experience as general training. The experience provides valuable transferable skills but does not meet the criteria for professional training in this degree program.
results.recommendation_reasoning: The work experience is not relevant to the Kätilö (AMK) degree program and does not provide any skills or knowledge applicable to the field of midwifery.
results.summary_justification: The work experience as an Electrical Engineer does not align with the Kätilö (AMK) degree program and therefore cannot be considered professional training. The experience could be considered as general training.
results.justification: The work experience does not meet the criteria for professional training as requested. The role and responsibilities are unrelated to the Kätilö (AMK) degree program. Student would receive 10.0 ECTS credits toward the 30-credit practical training requirement.
